hero.title: From Data to Deployment: 15 Minutes
hero.subtitle: Transform spreadsheet chaos into operational control. TraviXO's automated import processes 500+ assets, generates deployment-ready QR codes, and delivers real-time tracking so your team can focus on operations, not data entry.

1.title: Import 500 Assets in 5 Minutes
1.text: Smart column detection works with any spreadsheet format. No manual mapping, no data entry hell. Just upload and go.

2.title: Generate 500 QR Codes in 30 Seconds
2.text: Bulk QR generation creates print-ready PDFs instantly. No clicking through assets one by one.

3.title: Deploy Same Day
3.text: Most companies take weeks to get started. With TraviXO, you're tracking equipment the same day you sign up.

problem.title: Equipment Rental Companies Lose €50K-200K Annually
problem.subtitle: Poor tracking and manual processes are killing your profitability

1.title: 1-2% Asset Loss Every Year
1.text: For a €5M fleet, that's €50K-100K written off as 'missing' or 'stolen' annually. Equipment vanishes between sites, gets misplaced, or simply disappears.

2.title: €50K+ Per Quarterly Audit
2.text: Flying auditors to depots, manual counts with clipboards, 2 weeks of reconciliation work. Every quarter. And you still find discrepancies.

3.title: VGP Compliance Nightmares
3.text: One missed inspection = €15K+ DIRECCTE fine. Managing inspection schedules across hundreds of assets in spreadsheets is a disaster waiting to happen.

4.title: 40+ Hours of Data Entry
4.text: Traditional systems require weeks of manual setup. By the time you're done entering data, it's already outdated.

solution.title: TraviXO: From Zero to Tracking in 15 Minutes
solution.subtitle: Simple QR tracking that actually works in the real world

1.title: Import Excel
1.text: Upload your messy spreadsheet. We detect columns automatically. 500 assets imported in 5 minutes.

2.title: Generate QR Codes
2.text: Select all assets, click generate. Get a print-ready PDF with 500 QR codes in 30 seconds.

3.title: Start Scanning
3.text: No app needed. Field workers scan with any phone. Track location, status, and condition instantly.

4.title: Stay Compliant
4.text: Automated VGP alerts prevent €15K+ fines. Never miss an inspection deadline again.

finalCta.title: Ready to Stop Losing Equipment?
finalCta.subtitle: Join equipment rental companies who are eliminating asset loss and achieving VGP compliance effortlessly.

hero.title: About TraviXO
hero.subtitle: Built by equipment rental veterans who lived the problem

story.title: Our Story
story.paragraph1: TraviXO was born from field expertise. One of us worked in IT support at industry leaders like Loxam and Ariane. In this sector, even the best companies face the same challenges: tracking thousands of assets, maintaining accurate inventories, optimizing audits. That's when we realized a truly adapted tool was missing.
story.paragraph2: The other came from payroll management, a world where every data point matters, where traceability and compliance are non-negotiable. This methodical approach to compliance and reliability became TraviXO's foundation.
story.paragraph3: By combining these two types of expertise field IT and rigorous process management we built a tool that speaks to both technicians and decision-makers:

list.item3: Robust enough to prevent thousands in losses

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Help companies achieve total visibility over their equipment without weeks of spreadsheet reconciliation. TraviXO automates asset tracking, streamlines audits, and transforms spreadsheet chaos into operational clarity in under 15 minutes.

efficiency.title: Immediate Efficiency
efficiency.description: Every minute spent fighting with software is a minute stolen from real work. We build for speed and simplicity.

realWorld.title: Built for Reality
realWorld.description: Networks fail, data is incomplete, teams change. TraviXO works in these conditions, not just in perfect demos.

transparency.title: Total Transparency
transparency.description: Clear pricing, exportable data, zero vendor lock-in. You own your information.

customerFirst.title: Customer-Driven
customerFirst.description: Every feature comes from a real problem experienced by customers or by us before TraviXO.

founders.title: Our Roots

list.item1: An IT support specialist from demanding equipment environments
list.item2: A payroll management expert ensuring process reliability and compliance

founders.conclusion: TraviXO is developed in Paris, hosted in Europe, and GDPR compliant. Our ambition is simple: enable any company managing equipment to know what, where, and who in real-time.

cta.title: Ready to Track Smarter?

hero.title: Everything You Need to Master Asset Tracking
hero.subtitle: TraviXO combines straightforward QR technology with professional-grade automation to give you complete visibility, VGP compliance, and full fleet control. Zero manual data entry. Zero lengthy onboarding. Just immediate, intelligent tracking.

import.title: Smart Excel Import
import.description: Import 500 assets in 5 minutes. Smart column detection works with any spreadsheet format.

bulk.title: Bulk QR Generation
bulk.description: Generate 500 QR codes as print-ready PDF in 30 seconds. No clicking through assets one by one.

deploy.title: Deploy Immediately
deploy.description: Start tracking equipment the same day you sign up. No weeks of training or setup required.

moat.title: What Makes TraviXO Different
moat.subtitle: While competitors lock you into weeks of setup, TraviXO gets you tracking in minutes

import.title: Smart Excel Import
import.description: Upload your existing equipment spreadsheet and start tracking in 5 minutes. Our intelligent column detection automatically maps Serial Numbers, Locations, Purchase Dates - even if your headers are in French, use abbreviations, or don't match our format. Import 500 assets faster than you can make coffee.
features: Automatic column detection (works with any language)
Handles messy data (blank cells, merged columns, weird formats)
Validates as it imports (catches errors before they become problems)
Preview before committing (see exactly what will import)
Supports Excel (.xlsx), CSV, and Google Sheets

bulk.title: Bulk Operations That Actually Work
bulk.description: Stop clicking through assets one by one. TraviXO's bulk operations let you manage hundreds of assets simultaneously - the way you actually work.
features: Generate 500 QR codes as a print-ready PDF in 30 seconds
Update status for 100+ assets at once (move entire depot to maintenance)
Bulk assign equipment to teams or locations
Export filtered data to CSV (only what you need, when you need it)
Delete with safety checks (we make you confirm, every time)

smart.title: Smart Enough to Save Time, Simple Enough to Use
smart.description: TraviXO doesn't require training manuals or consultant onboarding. If you can use a smartphone and Excel, you already know how to use TraviXO.
features: Mobile QR scanning works without installing an app
Offline mode (scan assets, sync later when you have internet)
Smart search (find assets by partial serial, nickname, or location)
Real-time dashboard updates (see changes as they happen)

qrTracking.title: QR Code Asset Tracking
qrTracking.description: Generate unlimited QR codes for your entire fleet. Each asset gets a unique, scannable code that links to its digital record in TraviXO.

mobileScanning.title: Mobile-First Scanning
mobileScanning.description: Your team can scan assets using any smartphone - no app download required. Fast, accurate, works in low light.

dashboards.title: Real-Time Dashboards
dashboards.description: Know exactly where every asset is, who has it, and when it was last verified. Filter by status, location, category, or custom fields.

audits.title: Digital Inventory Audits
audits.description: Replace manual audits with digital workflows. Generate expected asset lists, track verification progress in real-time, and flag discrepancies automatically.

integrations.title: Enterprise Integrations
integrations.description: Your asset data flows everywhere it needs to go. Push to ServiceNow, sync costs to QuickBooks, or build custom integrations via webhooks.

teamSecurity.title: Team Management & Security
teamSecurity.description: Role-based permissions, audit logs, and multi-location support ensure your team has the right access.

questions.question: Why is VGP compliance not included in the Starter plan?
questions.answer: The Starter plan is designed for basic asset tracking only. VGP compliance requires advanced features (inspection scheduling, certificate management, DIRECCTE reporting) available from the Professional plan onwards. For French equipment rental companies, we strongly recommend the Professional plan.

questions.question: What's the difference between monthly and annual billing?
questions.answer: Annual billing is our default option and offers a 15% discount compared to monthly payments. For example, the Professional plan costs €14,400/year (€1,200/month) with annual billing, versus €1,412/month with monthly billing.

questions.question: Can I change plans at any time?
questions.answer: Yes, you can upgrade your plan at any time. Downgrades are possible at the end of your annual billing period. Contact our team to discuss your specific situation.

questions.question: Are extensions compatible with all plans?
questions.answer: The Extra Assets Pack is available for all plans. Other extensions (predictive AI, ERP integrations, priority SLA) require the Professional plan or higher.

questions.question: Do you offer a trial period?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer a 30-day trial period for all plans with full access to features. No credit card required to start.

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.paragraph1: TraviXO Systems ("TraviXO," "we," "us," or "our") operates travixosystems.com and provides QR-based asset tracking software. We are committed to protecting your personal data and respecting your privacy rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws.
section1.paragraph2: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your information when you use our website and services.

section2.title: 2. Data Controller
section2.intro: The data controller responsible for your personal data is:

subsection1.title: 3.1 Information You Provide
subsection1.intro: We collect information you voluntarily provide when you:
subsection1.item1: Fill out contact forms (name, email, company, phone number, message)
subsection1.item4: Subscribe to our newsletter or updates
subsection1.item5: Communicate with us via email or phone

subsection2.title: 3.2 Automatically Collected Information
subsection2.intro: When you visit our website, we automatically collect:
subsection2.item1: IP address and geographic location (country/city level)
subsection2.item4: Pages visited and time spent on pages

subsection3.title: 3.3 Cookies and Tracking Technologies
subsection3.content: We use essential cookies to ensure our website functions properly. We do not use advertising or tracking cookies. You can disable cookies in your browser settings, though this may affect website functionality.

section4.title: 4. How We Use Your Information
section4.intro: We use your personal data for the following purposes:

item1.title: Service Delivery:
item1.description: To respond to inquiries, provide demos, and onboard pilot customers

item2.title: Communication:
item2.description: To send you updates about your pilot, product features, and support

item3.title: Improvement:
item3.description: To analyze website usage and improve our services

item4.title: Legal Compliance:
item4.description: To comply with legal obligations and resolve disputes

item5.title: Marketing:
item5.description: To send promotional emails (with your explicit consent, which you can withdraw anytime)

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis (GDPR Article 6):
legalBasis.intro: We process your data based on:
legalBasis.item2: Contractual necessity (to provide services you requested)
legalBasis.item3: Legitimate interests (to improve our services and prevent fraud)
legalBasis.item4: Legal obligations (to comply with tax and regulatory requirements)

section5.title: 5. Data Sharing and Disclosure
section5.intro: We do not sell your personal data. We may share your information with:

item1.title: Service Providers:
item1.description: Hosting providers (Vercel), email services, analytics tools (only EU-based providers)

item2.title: Legal Requirements:
item2.description: If required by law, court order, or government authority

item3.title: Business Transfers:
item3.description: In the event of a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets

section5.footer: All third-party service providers are contractually obligated to protect your data and only process it according to our instructions.

section6.title: 6. Data Storage and Security

storage.title: Storage Location:
storage.description: All data is stored on servers located in the European Union (France).

security.title: Security Measures:
security.intro: We implement industry-standard security measures including:
security.item2: Encryption at rest for sensitive data

section6.disclaimer: While we take reasonable precautions, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure. We cannot guarantee absolute security.

section7.title: 7. Data Retention
section7.intro: We retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this policy:

item3.title: Active customer data:
item3.duration: Duration of subscription + 3 years (for legal/tax purposes)

item4.title: Marketing consent:
item4.duration: Until you withdraw consent or 3 years of inactivity

section7.footer: After retention periods expire, we securely delete or anonymize your data.

section8.title: 8. Your Rights Under GDPR
section8.intro: As an EU data subject, you have the following rights:

right1.title: Right of Access:
right1.description: Request a copy of your personal data

right3.title: Right to Erasure ("Right to be Forgotten"):

right4.title: Right to Restriction:
right4.description: Limit how we process your data

right5.title: Right to Data Portability:
right5.description: Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format

right6.title: Right to Object:
right6.description: Opt out of certain processing activities (e.g., marketing)

right7.title: Right to Withdraw Consent:
right7.description: Withdraw consent at any time (does not affect prior processing)

contact.intro: To exercise any of these rights, contact us at:
contact.response: We will respond to your request within 30 days. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority (CNIL in France).

section9.title: 9. Children's Privacy
section9.content: Our services are not intended for individuals under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If we become aware that we have collected data from a child, we will delete it promptly.

section10.title: 10. International Data Transfers
section10.content: We do not transfer your data outside the European Economic Area (EEA). All data processing occurs within EU-based infrastructure to ensure GDPR compliance.

section11.title: 11. Changes to This Policy
section11.intro: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of significant changes by:
section11.method1: Posting the updated policy on this page with a new "Last Updated" date
section11.method2: Sending an email notification (if you are a customer or have subscribed)
section11.footer: Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

section12.title: 12. Contact Us
section12.intro: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or how we handle your data, contact us:

section1.title: 1. Agreement to Terms
section1.paragraph1: By accessing or using TraviXO's website (travixosystems.com) and services ("Services"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you do not agree to these Terms, do not use our Services.
section1.paragraph2: These Terms constitute a legally binding agreement between you (the "Customer," "you," or "your") and TraviXO Systems ("TraviXO," "we," "us," or "our").

section2.title: 2. Description of Services
section2.intro: TraviXO provides QR-based asset tracking software designed for equipment rental and leasing companies. Our Services include:
section2.item1: QR code generation and asset tracking
section2.footer: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue any part of the Services at any time with reasonable notice.

subsection1.title: 3.1 Account Creation
subsection1.intro: To use certain features of our Services, you must create an account. You agree to:
subsection1.item1: Provide accurate, current, and complete information
subsection1.item2: Maintain and update your information to keep it accurate
subsection1.item3: Keep your password secure and confidential
subsection1.item4: Notify us immediately of any unauthorized access to your account

subsection2.title: 3.2 Account Responsibility
subsection2.content: You are responsible for all activities that occur under your account. You must be at least 18 years old to create an account.

subsection1.title: 4.1 Pricing and Payment
subsection1.paragraph1: Subscription fees are based on the plan you select (Starter, Professional, Scale, or Enterprise). Prices are listed on our Pricing page and are subject to change with 30 days' notice.
subsection1.paragraph2: Payment is due monthly or annually in advance, depending on your chosen billing cycle. We accept credit cards and bank transfers (for Enterprise plans).

subsection2.title: 4.2 Auto-Renewal
subsection2.content: Subscriptions automatically renew at the end of each billing period unless you cancel before the renewal date. You will be charged using your payment method on file.

subsection3.title: 4.3 Refunds
subsection3.content: We offer a 14-day money-back guarantee for first-time subscribers. After 14 days, fees are non-refundable. Refunds for unused portions of annual subscriptions are prorated if you cancel mid-term.

subsection4.title: 4.4 Late Payment
subsection4.content: If payment fails, we will attempt to charge your payment method up to 3 times. If payment is not received within 7 days, your account may be suspended. We may charge a late fee of €25 or 5% of the outstanding balance, whichever is greater.

subsection1.title: 5.1 Your Right to Cancel
subsection1.content: You may cancel your subscription at any time by contacting us or using the cancellation feature in your account settings. Cancellation takes effect at the end of your current billing period.

subsection2.title: 5.2 Our Right to Terminate
subsection2.intro: We may suspend or terminate your account if you:
subsection2.item2: Fail to pay fees when due
subsection2.item3: Engage in fraudulent or illegal activity
subsection2.item4: Use the Services in a way that harms TraviXO or other users
subsection2.footer: We will provide reasonable notice before termination unless immediate termination is required for legal or security reasons.

subsection3.title: 5.3 Effect of Termination
subsection3.content: Upon termination, your access to the Services will cease. You will have 30 days to export your data before it is permanently deleted. Fees paid are non-refundable except as stated in Section 4.3.

section6.title: 6. Acceptable Use Policy
section6.item1: Use the Services for any illegal purpose
section6.item2: Attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems
section6.item3: Reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble the Services
section6.item4: Upload malicious code, viruses, or malware
section6.item5: Interfere with or disrupt the Services or servers
section6.item6: Resell or redistribute the Services without authorization
section6.item7: Use the Services to infringe on intellectual property rights

subsection1.title: 7.1 Our Ownership
subsection1.content: TraviXO retains all rights, title, and interest in the Services, including all software, designs, trademarks, and documentation. These Terms do not grant you any ownership rights.

subsection2.title: 7.2 Your Content
subsection2.paragraph1: You retain ownership of all data you upload to TraviXO ("Customer Data"). You grant us a limited license to store, process, and display your data solely to provide the Services.
subsection2.paragraph2: You represent that you have the right to upload Customer Data and that it does not violate any laws or third-party rights.

subsection3.title: 7.3 Feedback
subsection3.content: If you provide feedback, suggestions, or ideas about the Services, we may use them without obligation to you.

section8.title: 8. Data Protection and Privacy
section8.paragraph1: Our collection and use of personal data is governed by our Privacy Policy. By using the Services, you consent to our data practices as described in the Privacy Policy.
section8.paragraph2: We implement reasonable security measures to protect your data, but we cannot guarantee absolute security. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials.

section9.title: 9. Service Level and Availability
section9.paragraph1: We strive to provide reliable Services but do not guarantee uninterrupted access. The Services are provided "as is" and "as available." We may perform maintenance that temporarily affects availability, and we will provide advance notice when possible.

sla.title: Service Level Agreement (SLA):
sla.content: Enterprise customers receive a 99.9% uptime SLA as specified in their contract. Other plans do not include an SLA.

section10.title: 10. Limitation of Liability
section10.intro: To the fullest extent permitted by law:
section10.paragraph1: TraviXO and its affiliates, officers, employees, and agents will not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including loss of profits, revenue, data, or use, arising from:
section10.item1: Your use of or inability to use the Services
section10.item3: Errors, bugs, or interruptions in the Services
section10.paragraph2: Our total liability to you for any claim arising from these Terms or the Services will not exceed the fees you paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.
section10.paragraph3: Some jurisdictions do not allow exclusion of certain warranties or limitations on liability, so these limitations may not apply to you.

section11.title: 11. Indemnification
section11.intro: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless TraviXO from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses (including legal fees) arising from:
section11.item3: Your violation of any laws or third-party rights
section11.item4: Customer Data you upload to the Services

subsection1.title: 12.1 Governing Law
subsection1.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of France, without regard to conflict of law principles.

subsection2.title: 12.2 Jurisdiction
subsection2.content: Any disputes arising from these Terms or the Services will be resolved exclusively in the courts of Paris, France. You consent to the personal jurisdiction of these courts.

subsection3.title: 12.3 Informal Resolution
subsection3.content: Before filing a legal claim, you agree to contact us at contact@travixosystems.com to attempt to resolve the dispute informally.

section13.title: 13. Changes to These Terms
section13.intro: We may update these Terms from time to time. We will notify you of material changes by:
section13.method1: Posting the updated Terms on this page with a new "Last Updated" date
section13.method2: Sending an email notification (for active customers)
section13.footer: Your continued use of the Services after changes take effect constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms. If you do not agree to the changes, you must cancel your subscription.

subsection1.title: 14.1 Entire Agreement
subsection1.content: These Terms, together with our Privacy Policy, constitute the entire agreement between you and TraviXO regarding the Services.

subsection2.title: 14.2 Severability
subsection2.content: If any provision of these Terms is found to be unenforceable, the remaining provisions will continue in full force and effect.

subsection3.title: 14.3 Waiver
subsection3.content: Our failure to enforce any right or provision of these Terms will not be deemed a waiver of that right or provision.

subsection4.title: 14.4 Assignment
subsection4.content: You may not assign these Terms without our prior written consent. We may assign these Terms without restriction.

subsection5.title: 14.5 Force Majeure
subsection5.content: Neither party will be liable for any delay or failure to perform due to causes beyond its reasonable control (e.g., natural disasters, war, pandemics, government actions).

section15.intro: If you have questions about these Terms, contact us:
